grammarPoints.usage: Use '竟然' to express surprise at unexpected events
Use '居然' similar to '竟然' with surprise
Use '偏偏' for actions against expectation or advice
Use '明明' to emphasize obvious facts
Use '分明' similar to '明明' (more formal)
Use '索性' for straightforward decisions
Use '不妨' for gentle suggestions
Use '何不' for suggestions (slightly formal)
Use '不禁' for involuntary actions
Use '禁不住' similar to '不禁'
Use '忍不住' for inability to resist
Use '情不自禁' for emotional inability to control
Use '不由得' for involuntary reactions
Use '不得不说' for reluctant admission
Use '说实话' to introduce honest statement
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: To tell the truth, I don't really like it

grammarPoints.usage: Use '老实说' similar to '说实话'
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: To be honest, I don't know either

grammarPoints.usage: Use '坦白说' for frank admission
Use '严格来说' for precise statements
Use '一般来说' for general statements
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Generally speaking, he won't be late

grammarPoints.usage: Use '总的来说' for overall evaluation
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: On the whole, it's not bad

grammarPoints.usage: Use '相对来说' for relative comparison
Use '换句话说' to rephrase

grammarPoints.meaning: that is to say/in other words
grammarPoints.usage: Use '也就是说' to explain or clarify
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: That is to say, you disagree

grammarPoints.usage: Use '换言之' for formal rephrasing
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: In other words, this is impossible

grammarPoints.meaning: from this it can be seen/thus
grammarPoints.usage: Use '由此可见' to draw conclusions
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: From this it can be seen that he works hard

grammarPoints.usage: Use '由此看来' for inference
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Judging from this, the situation is not good

grammarPoints.usage: Use '看样子' for observation-based inference
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It looks like it's going to rain

grammarPoints.usage: Use '看来' for conclusions based on evidence
Use '据我所知' to introduce known information
grammarPoints.example: 据我所知，他已经离开了
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: As far as I know, he has already left

grammarPoints.meaning: to the best of my knowledge
grammarPoints.usage: Use '就我所知' similar to '据我所知'
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: To the best of my knowledge, this is true

grammarPoints.usage: Use '据说是' for reported information with assertion
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: It is said to be done by him

grammarPoints.usage: Use '似乎' for tentative observations
Use '仿佛' for comparisons or impressions
Use '好似' similar to '仿佛' (literary)
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: seem like returning to the past

grammarPoints.usage: Use '宛如' for poetic comparisons
Use '犹如' for formal similes
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: like a bolt from the blue

grammarPoints.usage: Use '恰似' for precise comparisons (literary)
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: exactly like a spring breeze on the face

grammarPoints.usage: Use '无非是' to minimize or explain
Use '无非' to limit scope
Use '说不定' for uncertain possibilities
Use '难说' to express uncertainty
Use '保不准' for uncertain predictions
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Can't say for sure if it'll rain tomorrow

grammarPoints.usage: Use '难保' for things hard to guarantee
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Hard to ensure there won't be problems

grammarPoints.usage: Use '倒是' to introduce contrasting fact

grammarPoints.meaning: might as well/would be better to
grammarPoints.usage: Use '倒不如' for suggestions or preferences

grammarPoints.meaning: in my opinion/the way I see it
grammarPoints.usage: Use '依我看' to introduce personal view
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: In my opinion, this is wrong

grammarPoints.meaning: if you ask me/in my view
grammarPoints.usage: Use '照我说' similar to '依我看'
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If you ask me, we should go

grammarPoints.usage: Use '在我看来' for personal perspective
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: In my view, this is important

grammarPoints.usage: Use '依然如故' for unchanged situations (literary)
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Everything remains the same as before

grammarPoints.usage: Use '一如既往' for consistency
Use '照旧' for unchanged patterns
Use '依旧' for continuing states
Use '照样' for unchanged actions despite circumstances
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Still go even if it rains

grammarPoints.usage: Use '一样' for similarity in manner
Use '同样' for similar actions or states
Use '照此下去' for projecting trends
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: At this rate, will definitely succeed

grammarPoints.meaning: if this continues/in the long run
grammarPoints.usage: Use '长此以往' for long-term consequences
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: If this continues, problems will arise

grammarPoints.usage: Use '如此一来' for consequences of action
Use '这样一来' similar to '如此一来'
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: In this way, everyone is convenient

grammarPoints.usage: Use '于是' for sequential actions or results
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He was tired, so he went to sleep

grammarPoints.usage: Use '随即' for immediate subsequent action
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He heard the news and immediately rushed over

grammarPoints.usage: Use '随后' for actions following shortly
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I'll go first, you come soon after

grammarPoints.usage: Use '接着' for continuing sequence
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: After eating, then go for a walk

grammarPoints.usage: Use '紧接着' for immediate sequence
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: After he finished speaking, he immediately left

grammarPoints.usage: Use '继而' for formal sequence (written)
Use '进而' for progressive development
Use '从而' to show means leading to result
grammarPoints.example: 努力学习，从而取得成功

grammarPoints.usage: Use '进一步' for additional development

grammarPoints.meaning: go even further/take it a step further
grammarPoints.usage: Use '更进一步' for advancement
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: We need to go even further

grammarPoints.usage: Use '反过来说' to present opposite view
Use '话说回来' to introduce counterpoint
grammarPoints.example: 话说回来，我们也有责任
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: That said, we also have responsibility

grammarPoints.meaning: but then again/on the other hand
grammarPoints.usage: Use '话又说回来' similar to '话说回来'
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: But then again, this isn't easy

grammarPoints.usage: Use '再说' to add additional reason
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I'm not going, and besides, I don't have time

grammarPoints.usage: Use '而且' to add supporting information
Use '况且' to add reinforcing reason
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I can't, and besides I don't want to learn

grammarPoints.usage: Use '更何况' to emphasize stronger case
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Even I can't, let alone you

grammarPoints.usage: Use '再者' for additional points (formal)
Use '另外' to introduce separate point
Use '此外' for formal addition
Use '除此之外' to add to previous point
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Besides this, there's no other choice

grammarPoints.usage: Use '不仅如此' to exceed previous statement
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Not only that, there's even more

grammarPoints.usage: Use '岂止' to indicate exceeding expectation
Use '何止' similar to '岂止'
Use '不过' for mild contrast
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Very good, but a bit expensive

grammarPoints.usage: Use '然而' for formal contrast
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: He worked hard, however he failed

grammarPoints.usage: Use '可是' for informal contrast
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I want to go, but I don't have time

grammarPoints.usage: Use '只是' to introduce limiting factor
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: I agree, it's just that I'm a bit worried

grammarPoints.usage: Use '只不过' to minimize or explain
Use '无非就是' to limit scope or explain
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Nothing more than wanting to make money

grammarPoints.usage: Use '顶多' for maximum limit
Use '充其量' similar to '顶多' (more formal)
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: At best it's just a beginning

grammarPoints.usage: Use '至于' to introduce new topic
grammarPoints.example: 至于价格，我们可以商量
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: As for the price, we can discuss

grammarPoints.usage: Use '关于' to introduce subject matter
Use '对于' for attitudes or actions toward something
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: With regard to this matter, I care a lot

grammarPoints.usage: Use '针对' for targeted actions
grammarPoints.example: 针对这个问题提出建议
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Propose suggestions directed at this problem

grammarPoints.usage: Use '鉴于' for formal consideration of circumstances
Use '基于' for foundations or bases
Use '根据' for information source or basis
Use '按照' for following rules or standards
Use '依照' similar to '按照' (more formal)
Use '遵照' for following instructions or orders
Use '按' as short form of '按照'
Use '就...而言' to limit scope of statement
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: As far as I'm concerned, no problem

grammarPoints.usage: Use '从...角度来看' to state viewpoint
Use '就...方面来说' to specify aspect
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: In terms of quality, it's very good

grammarPoints.usage: Use '不管怎么说' to introduce bottom line
Use '总而言之' to summarize
Use '总之' for brief summary
Use '简而言之' for concise summary

grammarPoints.meaning: in a word/to sum up in one sentence
grammarPoints.usage: Use '一言以蔽之' for ultimate summary (literary)
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: In a word, it's a failure

grammarPoints.usage: Use '归根结底' to get to essence
grammarPoints.example: 归根结底，还是钱的问题
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: In the final analysis, it's still a money issue

grammarPoints.usage: Use '归根到底' similar to '归根结底'

grammarPoints.meaning: after all is said and done/ultimately
grammarPoints.usage: Use '说到底' for fundamental truth
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: After all is said and done, rely on yourself

grammarPoints.usage: Use '到头来' for final outcome (often negative)
Use '最终' for final result
Use '终究' for inevitable outcome
Use '毕竟还是' for expected outcome
Use '总算' for relief at completion
Use '好不容易' to emphasize difficulty
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Finally found it with great difficulty

grammarPoints.usage: Use '好容易' similar to '好不容易'
Use '费了好大劲' to emphasize effort spent
grammarPoints.exampleTranslation: Took great effort to convince him

grammarPoints.usage: Use '颇为' for considerable degree (formal)
Use '颇有' to indicate considerable possession
Use '略微' for small degree (formal)
Use '略有' for small possession
Use '大为' for large degree (formal)
Use '大大' for significant degree
Use '极为' for extreme degree (formal)
Use '极其' similar to '极为'
Use '万分' for intense degree
Use '分外' for exceptional degree (literary)
Use '越发' for increasing degree
Use '愈加' similar to '越发' (more formal)
Use '愈发' for progressive increase (literary)
Use '日益' for gradual increase (formal)
Use '日渐' similar to '日益'
Use '逐渐' for gradual change
Use '逐步' for methodical progression
Use '一再' for repeated actions
Use '再三' similar to '一再'
Use '屡次' for multiple occurrences
Use '屡屡' similar to '屡次' (more literary)
Use '时常' for frequent actions
Use '时而...时而...' for alternating states
Use '有时候...有时候...' for occasional variation
